entries.meaning: (cryptography) A string representing an encoded piece of text.
examples: Bob cannot get any information out of the codeword since he doesn't know what transmission bases Alice used.

entries.meaning: A word or phrase (or by extension a concept) used to make a (concealed) reference to another word or concept.
examples: Even the most virtuous concepts were scrutinised by governments eager to interpret them as codewords for something unwelcome.

entries.meaning: A type of crossword puzzle where the letters of the alphabet are represented by numbers and the solver must identify them by their position and frequency.
